cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSW of Freeport, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW toward the central Texas coast, then forecast to slow, turn north and northeast, skirting the upper Texas coast and moving inland toward Louisiana

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA (tropical-storm); Port Aransas, TX to Sabine Pass, TX including Galveston Bay (storm-surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay, extending east into southern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained near 45 mph with higher gusts) are almost certain (99% probability) to affect Texas City beginning today and continuing into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in Galveston Bay and the Texas City area according to the Storm Surge Warning.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with locally higher totals up to 15 inches possible, creating a high flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rain bands and dangerous surf/rip currents.
